text: Are association types from the CRMv3 API something that will be exposed in the CRM UI soon? Just got a request from our team to track solution partners associated with a deal, and having visible association types sounds like a good use case for that

I have a multi-page setup in place where selections are made and data stored in the session. This is working just fine, up to the end. In the last page, I need to run a function AFTER a form is filled out that runs some calculations. It is collecting the data from the session variables and making some calculations to then spit out into a final variable. So the question… how do I get this function to trigger after the form is submitted? I have all of the javascript currently in the used templates for the pages.
For contact to company association they are exposed in the UI but it’s in a beta right now so you may not have seen it
Good to know. What’s the likelihood of that extending to Deals?
I don’t believe there are any immediate plans right now but I’ll definitely let the team know this is something people are asking about
Form directs to a final page, where the calculated results will display.

FWIW, my feeling is that the number of situations in which it makes sense for general CRM features to be contact-only or contact<>company only are few and far between.

This is one of our company’s biggest frustrations with HubSpot. I know y’all are working to improve that with lists, workflows, reporting, etc.

But, at the same time, you’re repeating the mistake here.

Can anyone help me setup a flexible URL redirect that sends any variation of a page that begins with a word to one page?
For example `<https://www.example.com/digital[anything-after-this]>`to a specific page?
Are you using a HS form for this? (on the last page)

Yes. I actually got it all working. :slightly_smiling_face: Didn’t need to connect anything to the form specifically, but you have to fill out the form to get to the last page. It’s all good now, just tweaking some display elements. This has been a bit of a beast to take down. Thanks for the reply!
`<https://www.example.com/digital>**rest-of-url*`
if it is digital/somepage you should do `<https://www.example.com/digital/*restofurl>`
basicaly the * creates the wildcard.
good job
maybe share it when you get it wrapped up!
Thanks Nick! I’ll see if I’m allowed to share, publically at least. :)
So I tried that but it threw an error since the wildcard didn’t start immediately after the `/`
can you give me two examples of the urls that you want this to cover?

I would want these original URLs:`<https://www.example.com/digital-checklists>`, `<https://www.example.com/digital-lists>`, or `<https://www.example.com/digital-cleaning-lists>` to all redirect to `<https://www.example.com/sanitization>`.

HMM, I feel like that should work, I just tested it out myself and it doesn't. It also doesn't report back an error saying it needs to start after a /

Have you reached out to support on this? I feel like this is a bug or was overlooked during creation of tool

I haven’t reached out to support yet. Wanted to see if it was solvable before doing so. For the record, the error thrown back doesn’t say it needs to start after a `/`. That was just the only way I was able to make it work.

yup, same with me. I mentioned that because they aren't saying it is wrong because of that, it is likely just doing a regex call to find a * or a : after a slash and not checking for characters inbetween...
I’ll see if support can shed any light. I appreciate your help.
ehhh..sometimes confirming someone isn't crazy is all i can do :wink:
Help
I made a small change to a page and now all of the links (which show in the code) are not working on the page!
Across all pages that use the same template :point_up_2:
Hi Gary - we'd need to see the code to help?
